Name:  ___               Unit No:   ___

No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___
 
Chief Complaint:
Altered mental status
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
___ with H/O CAD with prior STEMI, proximal LAD stenting ___, 
diagonal PTCA ___, s/p CABG x4 on ___ (LIMA-LAD, SVG-PLV, 
SVG-OM, SVG-Diag for mid LAD 50%, occluded OM1, mid-distal RCA 
80%), prior left ventricular systolic heart failure with 
recovery in LVEF post-CABG, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation on 
apixaban, stroke ___, tachycardi-bradycardia syndrome s/p 
recent ___ ICD placement (placed in ___ ___, for 2 >8 
sec pauses per patient), ___, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, 
who presented from his PCP's office with concerns for volume 
overload, lower extremity wounds, lethargy and hypoglycemia.

Patient reports that the night prior to admission (___) he took 
40 mg of oxycodone for lower back pain. At baseline, he takes 20 
mg QID:PRN when in US, though was taking higher doses (40 mg) in 
___. Per PCP, patient takes opioids for chronic back pain 
following a MVA but has no history of disordered opiate usage.

Patient reports taking 40 Units of Lantus at night ___. He has 
been eating regular meals and snacks throughout the day/night. 
He ran out of lancets and was unable to check his sugars for the 
past few days. He takes a sliding scale of Lantus based on his 
bedtime sugars. For example, if his sugars are low he will take 
20 Units of lantus and if his sugars are high he takes ___ 
Units of lantus. He reports taking ___ Units of Humalog SS with 
meals. Per PCP, patient takes 40 Units of lantus at night. 
Patient states he believes his blood sugars have been low the 
past few days. On ___, he fell presumably in setting of low 
blood sugar. He denied loss of consciousness or headstrike. He 
denied feeling lightheaded/dizzy before fall but states he fell 
because his gait becomes unstable when he has low blood sugars. 
He fell on his left hip. He also reported having 3 falls total 
in the last few weeks.

On ___, he presented to his PCP's office for routine check-up. 
VS at the ___'s office: 65 in, 270.4 lbs, BP 146/88, RR 18, HR 
86, Temp 97.3, SaO2 95% on RA. Exam at ___'s office notable for 
wounds on legs, cyanotic feet, dry skin, and a  tense abdomen. 
Patient had episode of "passing out" when they attempted to draw 
blood for labs, but never lost consciousness. Labs at ___ office 
notable for sugar ___. He received ___, bread, glucose 
tabs, and sugars improved to 300s. He was persistently drowsy 
and received naloxone 0.4 mg IV and woke up in 1 minute. Patient 
reported 1 episode of non-bloody diarrhea at ___'s office which 
he has not had previously.

Patient was last seen ___ for a cardiology appointment in 
___. After revascularization ___, his LVEF improved to 
60-65% from ___ pre-revascularization. He was found to have 
weight gain, chronic pedal edema, increased abdominal 
distension. Torsemide was increased to 40 mg BID. Dry weight per 
cardiologist was 250 lbs. Patient reports his cardiologist 
discontinued his Imdur.

Patient denies discharge from site of recent defibrillator 
placement. Patient endorsed chronic orthopnea, lower extremity 
edema, weight gain. He denied dyspnea at rest or with exertion. 
He reported taking all of his medications inconsistently and not 
adhering to low sodium/fluid restricted diet. In particular, he 
states that he doesn't like how torsemide makes him thirsty so 
takes it intermittently. 

In the ED, initial vitals: T 98.3 HR 72 BP 141/100 RR 18 SaO2 
97% on RA. Exam notable for irregularly irregular rhythm; no 
murmurs, rubs or gallops; mild end-expiratory wheezes, no 
crackles appreciated. Abdomen was tense and distended. Sutures 
at ICD pocket, area erythematous, non-tender to palpation. There 
was ___ pitting edema with hyperpigmentation bilaterally. CN 
II-XII grossly tested and intact, ___ strength, gross sensation 
to light touch intact, no slurred speech, A&Ox3. Labs notable 
for: CBC: WBC 7.1, Hb 12.5, plt 91. Fibrinogen 244. NT-pro-BNP 
848. Na 137, K 3.1, Cl 99, HCO3 28, BUN 20, Cr 1.0. ALT 12, AST 
32, AP 111, LDH 376, Tbili 1.4, Albumin 3.1. Troponin-T 0.02, 
0.01. UA Bland. CXR showed cardiomegaly with mild vascular 
congestion. EKG showed atrial fibrillation with a RBBB. Patient 
was given Atorvastatin 80 mg, torsemide 40 mg, apixaban 5 mg, 
potassium chloride 40 mEq po and 20 mEq IV. Vitals prior to 
transfer: ___ pain, T 98.8 HR 93 BP 153/104 RR 18 SaO2 96% on 
RA.

Upon arrival to the cardiology ward, patient reported back pain, 
but no chest pain or shortness of breath.

Review of systems: He denied fevers, chills, nausea vomiting, 
constipation, abdominal pain, cough, dysuria, urinary frequency.

ECG ___ 15:41:56
Atrial fibrillation with VR 97 bpm. Right bundle branch block

CXR ___ 6:54 ___
Compared with ___, patient has undergone interval 
placement of a left chest wall single lead pacemaker, with the 
lead terminating in the right ventricle.There is stable moderate 
cardiomegaly with mild pulmonary vascular congestion. No frank 
pulmonary edema. No pleural effusion. No pneumothorax. Median 
sternotomy wires and mediastinal clips are noted.
IMPRESSION: Cardiomegaly with mild pulmonary vascular congestion 
without frank edema or pleural effusion. 

CT CHEST W/O CONTRAST ___ 4:33 AM 
Left pectoral ICD. The patient has undergone sternotomy and 
CABG. No supraclavicular, infraclavicular or axillary 
lymphadenopathy. No incidental thyroid findings. Slight 
postoperative deviation of the trachea to the right, without 
substantial narrowing of the trachea. No mediastinal or hilar 
lymphadenopathy. Mild dilatation of the main pulmonary artery. 
Severe calcifications of the native coronary arteries. Moderate 
cardiomegaly. No pericardial effusion. The posterior mediastinum 
is normal, only normal sized lymph nodes are visualized (2, 47). 
No osteolytic lesions at the level of the ribs, the sternum, or 
the vertebral bodies. Mild degenerative vertebral disease. No 
vertebral compression fractures. Subtle non characteristic 
ground-glass opacity in the ante left lower lobe. Rior portion 
of the right upper lobe (302, 54). Subtle lingular scarring 
(302, 87). Subtle ___ nodularity in the left lower lobe 
(302, 98). Minimal scarring at the bases of the left lower lobe.
IMPRESSION: Status post sternotomy and CABG. Subtle ___ 
opacities and ground-glass nodularity, notably in the left lower 
lobe and the right upper lobe, infectious or inflammatory in 
origin substantial cardiomegaly with dilatation of the main 
pulmonary artery. No pulmonary edema. No suspicious pulmonary 
nodules or masses.

CT ABD & PELVIS W/O CONTRAST ___ 4:32 AM 
LOWER CHEST: Please refer to separate report of CT chest 
performed on the same day for description of the thoracic 
findings.
ABDOMEN:
HEPATOBILIARY: The liver demonstrates homogeneous attenuation 
throughout. There is no evidence of focal lesions within the 
limitations of an unenhanced scan. There is no evidence of 
intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The gallbladder 
contains gallstones without wall thickening or evidence of 
inflammation. 
PANCREAS: There is marked fatty infiltration of the pancreas. 
There is no pancreatic ductal dilatation. There is no 
peripancreatic stranding.
SPLEEN: The spleen shows normal size and attenuation throughout, 
without evidence of focal lesions.
ADRENALS: The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size 
and shape.
URINARY: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size. There is 
a 3.3 cm simple cyst arises from the lower pole of the left 
kidney. There is no hydronephrosis. There is no nephrolithiasis. 
There is no perinephric abnormality.
GASTROINTESTINAL: The stomach is unremarkable. Small bowel loops 
demonstrate normal caliber and wall thickness throughout. The 
colon and rectum are within normal limits. Normal appendix. 
There is trace mesenteric edema, without frank ascites. No 
retroperitoneal hematoma. 
PELVIS: Urinary bladder is unremarkable. There is no free fluid 
in the pelvis.
REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: The prostate and seminal vesicles are 
normal.
LYMPH NODES: There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric 
lymphadenopathy. There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.
VASCULAR: There is no abdominal aortic aneurysm. Extensive 
atherosclerotic disease is noted.
BONES: There is no evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or 
acute fracture.
SOFT TISSUES: Evaluation of the soft tissues is notable for 
diffuse body wall edema. There is a 6.7 x 2.8 cm lesion along 
the left lateral abdominal wall containing a fat fluid level 
(2:60). The dependent portion measures simple fluid attenuation. 
This likely represents a resolving hematoma.
IMPRESSION:
1. No intra-abdominal/retroperitoneal hematoma.
2. 6.7 x 2.8 cm lesion in the left lateral abdominal wall 
containing a fat-fluid level, likely reflecting a resolving 
hematoma.
3. Cholelithiasis.

Echocardiogram ___
The left atrial volume index is mildly increased. The right 
atrium is moderately enlarged. There is mild symmetric left 
ventricular hypertrophy with a moderately increased/dilated 
cavity. There is suboptimal image quality to assess regional 
left ventricular function. On the apical views the inferior wall 
appears to be hypokinetic but on short axis looks better. 
Overall left ventricular systolic function is mildly depressed. 
The visually estimated left ventricular ejection fraction is 
45%.Left ventricular cardiac index is depressed (less than 2.0 
L/min/m2). There is no resting left ventricular outflow tract 
gradient. No ventricular septal defect is seen. Moderately 
dilated right ventricular cavity with SEVERE global free wall 
hypokinesis. Intrinsic right ventricular systolic function is 
likely lower due to the severity of tricuspid regurgitation. 
There is abnormal septal motion c/w conduction abnormality/paced 
rhythm. The aortic sinus is mildly dilated with mildly dilated 
ascending aorta. The aortic arch is moderately dilated with a 
mildly dilated descending aorta. The aortic valve leaflets (3) 
appear structurally normal. There is no aortic valve stenosis. 
There is no aortic regurgitation. The mitral valve leaflets are 
mildly thickened with no mitral valve prolapse. There is trivial 
mitral regurgitation. The pulmonic valve leaflets are normal. 
The tricuspid valve leaflets appear structurally normal. There 
is SEVERE [4+] tricuspid regurgitation. Due to acoustic 
shadowing, the severity of tricuspid regurgitation may be 
UNDERestimated. The pulmonary artery systolic pressure could not 
be estimated. In the setting of at least moderate to severe 
tricuspid regurgitation, the pulmonary artery systolic pressure 
may be UNDERestimated. There is no pericardial effusion.
IMPRESSION: Moderately dilated, mildly hypokinetic left 
ventricle. Moderately dilated, severely hypokinetic right 
ventricle. Severe tricuspid regurgitation in setting of 
permanent pacemaker wire. Pulmonary artery pressure not measured 
to be high but RA pressure likely markedly elevated so estimate 
will be inaccurate. Mild to moderately dilated thoracic aorta. 
Compared with the prior ___, more tricuspid 
regurgitation is present. regional/global. LV function not 
likely different. Left ventricle is dilated

Echocardiogram ___
The right atrial pressure could not be estimated. There is mild 
symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy with a normal cavity 
size. There is suboptimal image quality to assess regional left 
ventricular function. Overall left ventricular systolic function 
is low normal. The visually estimated left ventricular ejection 
fraction is 50-55%.Moderately dilated right ventricular cavity 
with moderate global free wall hypokinesis. Intrinsic right 
ventricular systolic function is likely lower due to the 
severity of tricuspid regurgitation. There is abnormal septal 
motion c/w conduction abnormality/paced rhythm. The aortic valve 
leaflets (3) are mildly thickened. There is no aortic 
regurgitation. The mitral valve leaflets appear structurally 
normal with no mitral valve prolapse. There is mild [1+] mitral 
regurgitation. There is moderate to severe [3+] tricuspid 
regurgitation. Due to acoustic shadowing, the severity of 
tricuspid regurgitation may be UNDERestimated. There is mild 
pulmonary artery systolic hypertension.
IMPRESSION: Moderately dilated moderately hypokinetic right 
ventricle. Low normal global left ventricular systolic function. 
Moderate to severe tricuspid regurgitation with at least mild 
pulmonary hypertension. Compared with the prior ___, 
there has been a slight decrease in TR and improvement in RV 
function but there is still systolic flow reversal in the 
hepatic veins and reduced RV function. Increase in estimated 
PASP c/w improvement in RV systolic function.
RECOMMEND: If clinically indicated, a TEE is suggested for 
further evaluation of anatomy of the TV with regards to 
potential leaflet impingement by the ICD lead.

___ 09:05AM BLOOD Calcium-9.6 Phos-4.2 Mg-2.___ with H/O CAD S/P stenting of the LAD, PCI of a diagona, s/p 
CABG x4 on ___ (LIMA-LAD, SVG-PLV, SVG-OM, SVG-Diag), atrial 
fibrillation on apixaban, stroke ___, ___, hypertension, 
hyperlipidemia, tachycardia/bradycardia syndrome S/P recent 
single lead ICD placement (placed in ___ ___ who presented 
from ___'s office with concerns for volume overload, lower 
extremity wounds, lethargy and hypoglycemia. He was found to be 
20 pounds up from dry weight of 250 pounds. He received IV 
diuresis. His ICD was interrogated by the electrophysiology team 
and the sutures overlying his CIED pocket were removed. During 
his hospital stay, he was noted to have atrial fibrillation with 
ventricular rates up to 170 bpm with exertion. He was trialed on 
beta-blockers, but refused to take them as he reported that they 
provoked "panic attacks". His digoxin was uptitrated to maximize 
rate control. Non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers were 
not used given his heart failure and marginal LVEF.

ACUTE ISSUES:
# Acute on chronic biventricular systolic heart failure with 
recovered LVEF, hypertension, CAD: Ischemic cardiomyopathy with 
previous LVEF of 35%, improved to 65% in ___ after CABG ___ 
(LIMA-LAD, SVG-PLV, SVG-OM, SVG-Diag). Echocardiogram this 
admission showed LVEF 45% on ___ and then 50-55% on ___ with 
RV failure and severe tricuspid regurgitation. He presented with 
volume overload 20 lbs above dry weight with edema in his legs 
and abdomen. Exacerbation was thought to be due to 
medication/dietary nonadherence, with possible contribution from 
increased atrial fibrillation. He was diuresed with IV 
furosemide then transitioned to home torsemide 40 mg daily. 
However, he had very high urine output consistently >3L on this 
regimen, so this was dose reduced to 40 mg every other day. 
Losartan was increased from 75 mg daily to 100 mg daily and 
amlodipine stopped. He had been prescribed isosorbide 
mononitrate 120 mg daily as an outpatient but per the patient 
his cardiologist had told him to discontinue it prior to 
admission. He was restarted on a lower dose 30 mg daily this 
admission. Spironolactone was decreased from 25 mg daily to 12.5 
mg daily due to elevated potassium. Patient was provided with 
referral information and a prescription for outpatient cardiac 
rehabilitation.

# Atrial fibrillation, on apixaban: He presented in atrial 
fibrillation with VR bursts to 140s. He was trialed on beta 
blocker but this was poorly tolerated due to panic attacks. His 
home digoxin was increased to 0.25 mg daily (increased from home 
0.125 mg daily) with improved rate control. He was continued on 
home apixaban.

# Chronic back pain: Intermittent lethargy at ___'s office in 
setting of hypoglycemia and possibly oxycodone overdose which 
improved after naloxone. He was restarted on home oxycodone 20 
mg q6h with no further lethargy.

# Type 2 diabetes mellitus, on insulin, with hypoglycemia: HbA1C 
7.8% in ___, 8.4% on admission. Prior to admission, he had an 
episode of hypoglycemia while not checking blood glucose at home 
due to running out of lancets. ___ was consulted and 
decreased his insulin regimen to 10 units of Lantus at bedtime. 
He will need follow-up with ___ and could be considered for 
an oral regimen if able to adhere to diet.

# New ICD: ___ VR ICD placed in ___ ___. Per 
patient, this was placed for pauses >8 seconds x2. EKG showed 
atrial fibrillation with RBBB. CIED site with erythema, seen by 
EP who were not concerned for pocket infection, improved during 
admission. Echocardiogram showed moderate to severe tricuspid 
with RV lead in place. A TEE could be obtained for further 
evaluation of the anatomy of the TV with regards to potential 
leaflet impingement by the ICD lead.

# Falls: Patient with reported falls at home likely due to 
hypoglycemia and altered mental status. CT scan on ___ showed 
left abdominal 6.7 x 2.8 cm fluid collection
likely resolving hematoma. Patient was ambulating independently, 
so formal physical therapy evaluation was deferred.

CHRONIC ISSUES:
# Chronic venous stasis dermatitis with venous stasis ulcers: 
Wound care was consulted and recommended Hydrocerin moisturizing 
cream to toes and heels, Xeroform cause over open wounds, Kerlix 
wraps with daily dressing changes, ACE wraps to BLEs before 
getting out of bed for ___ minutes prior to application, 
removed at bedtime. 

# Thrombocytopenia, resolved: Patient presented with plts 90's 
of unclear etiology, improved to 200's this admission. 

# Hyperlipidemia: Continued home atorvastatin 80 mg daily

# HCP: Per patient, under no circumstances are we to call his 
son ___ (listed as emergency contact) to obtain any 
inform/update regarding hospitalization

#CODE: Full (presumed)

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
